intro: Hieracium glaucinum subsp. guaranum, commonly known as the Brazilian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and disturbed soils, preferring full sun. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. This subspecies is often found in regions with a temperate climate and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain areas.
